content.text: Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) has seen an increase in price from $85,056.15 to $87,072.95. Despite an earlier daily decline of -0.08%, the latest price trends indicate a recovery.
Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) has risen from $2,097.55 to $2,170.14. Initially, it experienced a daily decline of -0.14%, but the latest data suggests a positive trend.
Solana (SOL) has increased in price from $138.87 to $144.79. It initially faced a daily decline of -0.19%, but the latest figures show an upward movement.
The ai16z token has fluctuated in price, dropping from $0.322 to $0.297.

categories.title: ElizaOS Weekly Updates and Documentation Efforts

content.text: A community member has been commissioning montages of weekly updates for @ai16zdao and @elizaos to prevent information from getting scattered across different social channels. They are also working on a news or blog site to document the entire history and make it accessible for agents via RSS.

A new documentation update has been added for ElizaOS weekly contributor meetings. The update includes meeting notes from February 18 and February 25, 2025, covering discussions on the plugin ecosystem, Linea blockchain integration, V2 plugin management, ETH Denver updates, and documentation improvements.

The 'What Did You Get Done This Week? 12' documentation has been published, summarizing the ElizaOS 0.1.9 launch and ecosystem updates from January 31, 2025. The document highlights core improvements, agent communication innovations, new capabilities, organizational developments, partnerships, and community discussions.
Added buttons for navigating to the Home and Chat pages. UI/UX design improvements can be considered later.

A highly underrated thread featuring a demo video, sample code, tutorial, and flowcharts has been shared, providing valuable insights into AI development.
A perspective on productivity: being so busy that you don't even check the charts. This sentiment is accompanied by an image.

categories.title: Eliza v2 and Tako Protocol Updates

content.text: Tako Protocol has announced the open-sourcing of ELIZA Client-Tako, a newly developed module for ELIZA.
Eliza v2 hacking updates have been shared.

categories.title: Agent Development Updates and API Fixes

content.text: Agent development school will resume next week, not this week. The delay is to complete groundwork for version 2, which will be used in the school.

A fix has been implemented for API issues where certain operations, such as starting or editing an agent, resulted in an error due to accessing the agent's runtime before it was created. The update ensures that runtime checks are handled properly and that every runtime is correctly registered.

categories.title: Recent Fixes and Documentation Updates in ElizaOS

content.text: A build error has been fixed in the ElizaOS project.
Duplicate documentation in `plugins.md` has been removed to improve clarity. This change is low-risk and only affects documentation.

categories.title: Database Migration Fixes and Development Updates

content.text: A recent update focused on fixing static migration functionality for PostgreSQL and PGlite, improving reliability in database migrations. Key improvements include better error handling, resource management, and logging consistency. Additionally, proper shutdown handling was added for PGlite to prevent hanging processes.

Development efforts also included package improvements, such as removing duplicate documentation in plugins.md, introducing a new button for directing users to the home/chat page, and fixing two bugs. A total of six contributors merged five pull requests, with major work focused on various improvements.
A demo video, sample code, tutorial, and flowcharts were shared, receiving praise for their quality.

A community member has been commissioning montages of weekly updates for @ai16zdao and @elizaos to prevent information from getting lost across different social channels. Plans are in place to create a news or blog site to document the history and make it accessible via RSS.
@TakoProtocol has open-sourced ELIZA Client-Tako, a newly developed module for @elizaos.
StealthSDK has implemented a new feature powered by state-of-the-art reasoning models, allowing users to generate content dynamically.
Eliza v2 hacking updates were shared.
Agent development school will resume next week after groundwork for Eliza v2 is completed.
A new feature was added to ElizaOS, introducing buttons for navigating to the Home and Chat pages.
A fix was implemented to resolve API issues where certain operations resulted in errors due to accessing an agent's runtime before creation.
A build error was fixed in ElizaOS.
Duplicate documentation in plugins.md was removed.

Weekly contributor meeting notes for February 18 and February 25, 2025, were added, covering discussions on the plugin ecosystem, Linea blockchain integration, V2 plugin management, ETH Denver updates, and documentation improvements.
A new weekly community update document was added, covering the ElizaOS 0.1.9 launch, agent communication improvements, organizational developments, and partnership updates.
Fact retrieval was optimized, an environment fix was applied, and a reflection guard was improved for better JSON generation.
A fix was applied to static migrations for PostgreSQL and PGlite, improving reliability and error handling.
Quickstart documentation and plugin showcase were improved, with a sidebar added and various pages cleaned up for clarity.
Development efforts focused on package improvements, new features, and bug fixes, with six contributors merging five pull requests.
